title: A Randomized Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of MK-8189 in Participants With Alzheimer's Disease With or Without Symptoms of Agitation-Aggression and/or Psychosis
description_brief: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of multiple ascending doses of MK-8189 in participants with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) with or without symptoms of agitation-aggression and/or psychosis.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: This study was conducted at 8 sites in the United States.

groups.title: Titration 1: MK-8189
groups.description: Participants received MK-8189 8 mg on Days 1 to 3 and MK-8189 16 mg on Days 4 to 28 during Titration 1.

groups.title: Titration 1: Placebo
groups.description: Participants received placebo matched to MK-8189 during Titration 1.

groups.title: Titration 2: MK-8189
groups.description: Participants received MK-8189 8 mg on Days 1 to 3, 16 mg on Days 4 to 6, and 24 mg on Days 7 to 28 during Titration 2.

groups.title: Titration 2: Placebo
groups.description: Participants received placebo matched to MK-8189 during Titration 2.

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Who Experienced an Adverse Event (AE)
outcomeMeasures.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical study participant, temporally associated with the use of study intervention, whether or not considered related to the study intervention. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease (new or exacerbated) temporally associated with the use of a study intervention. Results are reported according to dose.

pointOfContact.title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development

explanation_target: Reason: The trial tests MK-8189 in Alzheimer's participants “with or without symptoms of agitation‑aggression and/or psychosis,” which indicates the intervention is being evaluated for neuropsychiatric symptoms rather than for disease modification of AD pathology. citeturn0search1

Reason (mechanism): MK-8189 is a potent, selective phosphodiesterase 10A (PDE10A) inhibitor — a small molecule that modulates striatal cyclic nucleotide signaling and has been developed for antipsychotic/symptom effects. This mechanism is symptomatic (neurotransmitter pathway modulation), not an anti‑amyloid or anti‑tau disease‑modifying approach. citeturn0search3turn0search4

Act (extraction): Drug name: MK-8189; drug type/mechanism: PDE10A inhibitor (small molecule); trial intervention includes placebo. The trial purpose statement explicitly focuses on safety/tolerability in AD participants with agitation/psychosis. citeturn0search1turn0search8

Act (supporting clinical data): MK-8189 has been tested in schizophrenia and showed antipsychotic effects in clinical studies, supporting its use to target psychosis/agitation symptoms. citeturn0search0turn0search7

Reflect: There is no evidence MK-8189 targets Alzheimer’s core pathology (amyloid or tau). Given its mechanism and the trial population/symptoms targeted, the correct category is neuropsychiatric symptom improvement (symptomatic treatment of agitation/psychosis), not a disease‑targeted biologic or small molecule for disease modification, nor a general cognitive enhancer. citeturn0search3turn0search6

Web search results (key sources referenced): 1) Trial listing for the AD study (NCT05227118) describing safety/tolerability study of MK-8189 in AD with/without agitation/psychosis. citeturn0search1 2) Discovery/chemistry paper describing MK-8189 as a selective PDE10A small molecule (Journal of Medicinal Chemistry). citeturn0search3 3) Preclinical pharmacology showing PDE10A inhibition, striatal target engagement, and behavioral effects relevant to psychosis/cognition. citeturn0search4 4) PubMed/clinical report of a Phase 2a schizophrenia trial showing antipsychotic (positive symptom) effects. citeturn0search0 5) ALZforum summary noting MK-8189 development and relevant behavioral/cognition preclinical data. citeturn0search6
explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational drug MK-8189 is a selective phosphodiesterase 10A (PDE10A) inhibitor that modulates striatal cyclic‑nucleotide signaling to produce antipsychotic/symptom effects rather than targeting AD core pathology. PDE10A inhibition acts on neurotransmitter signaling pathways (dopaminergic/striatal circuitry) and is therefore a symptomatic, neurotransmission‑modulating approach. citeturn0search0turn1search3

Act: Extracted details — drug: MK-8189; mechanism: PDE10A inhibitor (small molecule); trial purpose: safety/tolerability in AD participants with or without agitation‑aggression and/or psychosis (symptom treatment). Based on these details, the most specific CADRO match is D) Neurotransmitter Receptors (covers interventions that modulate neurotransmitter systems/synaptic signaling). citeturn1search1turn0search0

Reflect: PDE10A is an enzyme (not a classical receptor), but its inhibition modulates neurotransmitter‑related signaling (striatal dopamine pathways) and is used here to treat neuropsychiatric symptoms (agitation/psychosis) rather than to modify amyloid/tau or other disease mechanisms. No evidence the drug targets amyloid, tau, ApoE/lipids, inflammation, vasculature, or other CADRO categories — therefore D) Neurotransmitter Receptors is the appropriate CADRO category. citeturn0search0turn1search5
- Journal of Medicinal Chemistry discovery paper describing MK-8189 as a potent, selective PDE10A inhibitor. citeturn0search0
- Clinical trial registry entry for NCT05227118: randomized safety/tolerability study of MK-8189 in AD participants with/without agitation/psychosis. citeturn1search1
- ALZforum therapeutic summary noting the Phase 1 AD trial and focus on agitation/psychosis. citeturn1search3
- PubMed report of a Phase 2a schizophrenia trial showing antipsychotic/symptom effects for MK-8189, supporting its symptomatic (neurotransmission) mechanism. citeturn1search5
- Additional registry/overview confirming study details and completion status. citeturn1search2
